tit.cmt: JRではEmmachiと表示しているようです。そのため、このファイルではEmmachiとしています。

sen.j: 円町駅（えんまちえき）は、京都府京都市中京区西ノ京円町にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）山陰本線（嵯峨野線）の鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Located in Nishinokyo Enmachi, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, Enmachi Station is a stop on the San'in Main Line (Sagano Line), which is operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Enmachi Station, located in Nishinokyo Enmachi, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop on the San'in Main Line (Sagano Line), which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Emmachi Station, located in Nishinokyo Emmachi, Nakagyo Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop on the Sanin Main Line (Sagano Line), which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを削除し、sanin としました。

sen.j: 駅名電略は「オサエン」。
sen.e: The abbreviation of the station is "OSAEN."
The abbreviation for the station is "OSAEN."
The cable address of the station name is 'Osaen.'
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅（相互利用可能ICカードはICOCAの項を参照）。
sen.e: Stations at which ICOCA and J-Through are available (For information on mutually available IC card, refer to the section of ICOCA.)
Stations at which ICOCA and J-THRU are available (For information on mutually available IC card, refer to the section on ICOCA.)

ICOCA and J-Through Card, both of which are IC cards, are available for railway fare payment at this station; for information regarding the compatible IC card with ICOCA, please refer to the article about ICOCA.
sen.cmt: 一部翻訳を変更しました。

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 島式1面2線のプラットホームを持つ高架駅。
sen.e: It is an elevated station having an island platform, both sides of which are used for boarding and exiting trains.
It is an elevated station having an island platform, both sides of which are used to board and exit the trains.
It is an elevated station having an island platform with two tracks.

sen.j: 改札口は地上、ホームは2階にある。
sen.e: The ticket wicket is located on the ground level, while the platforms are on the second floor level.
The ticket wicket is located on the ground level, while the platforms are on the second-floor level.
The ticket gate is located on the ground level, while the platforms are on the second-floor level.

sen.j: 建物の構造としては、隣駅の二条駅、花園駅とよく似ている。
sen.e: It has a structure that is very similar to that of Nijo Station and Hanazono Station, its next stations for Local trains.
Its structure is very similar to that of Nijo Station and Hanazono Station, the next stations for local trains.
Its structure is very similar to that of Nijo Station and Hanazono Station, the next stations for local trains.

sen.j: 駅周辺
sen.e: Periphery of the station
The station's surroundings
Station surroundings
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 丸太町通が駅北側を東西方向に通り、駅のやや東方の円町交差点で西大路通と交わる。
sen.e: The Marutamachi-dori Street extends in a east-west direction on the north side of the station and intersects the Nishioji-dori Street at the Enmachi intersection that is located on a little east side of the station.

Marutamachi-dori Street extends in the east-west direction on the north side of the station and intersects Nishioji-dori Street at the Enmachi intersection, which is located slightly east of the station.

Marutamachi-dori Street extends in the east-west direction on the north side of the station and intersects Nishioji-dori Street at the Emmachi intersection, which is located slightly east of the station.

sen.j: 周辺は住宅が密集しており、通り沿いにはえんえんたうん等の商店街もある。
sen.e: This area is densely-packed with houses and there are some shopping areas such as En-En Town along the street.
This area is densely packed with houses, and there are shopping areas such as En-En Town along the street.
This area is densely packed with houses, and there are shopping areas such as En-En Town along the street.

sen.j: また、駅開業前に家電のニノミヤがオープンしたが、現在はミドリ電化の店舗となっている。
sen.e: A consumer-electronics maker, Ninomiya, had once opened before the station started its operation, but its store building is now run by Midori Denka Co., Ltd.
A consumer-electronics maker, Ninomiya, had once opened before the station started its operation, but its store building is now run by Midori Denka Co., Ltd.
A consumer-electronics maker, Ninomiya, had once opened before the station started its operation, but its store building is now run by Midori Denka Co., Ltd.

sen.e: Kyoto kami Labor Standards Supervision Office (The office was transferred to 3 Saiin Hiramachi, Ukyo Ward, on October 10, 2006 to rebuild the building and their business restarted at the new building on June 2, 2008.)

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History

History

sen.j: 2000年（平成12年）9月23日 - 二条～花園間の複線化とともに開業。
sen.e: September 23, 2000: Began its operation when the section between Nijo and Hanazono was doubly tracked.
September 23, 2000: Opeations when the section between Nijo and Hanazono was double-tracked.
September 23, 2000: Operations began when the section between Nijo and Hanazono was double-tracked.
sen.cmt: began を追加しました。スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 2001年（平成13年）4月2日 - 朝の上り快速3本が停車。
sen.e: April 2, 2001: Three up morning Rapid trains started stopping at this station.
April 2, 2001: Three morning rapid up trains began making stops at the station.
April 2, 2001: Three morning rapid inbound trains began making stops at the station.

sen.j: 2002年（平成14年）3月23日 - 快速終日停車駅となる。
sen.e: March 23, 2002: All Rapid tarins started stopping at this station at all hours.
March 23, 2002: All rapid trains started stopping at this station.
March 23, 2002: All rapid trains started stopping at this station.
